meanings.definition: A small metal or rubber piece attached to the heel of a shoe to prevent wear.
meanings.sent1: She replaced the worn-out heeltaps on her favorite boots.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler recommended adding heeltaps to the new shoes for durability.
meanings.sent3: The heeltaps on his shoes made a clicking sound as he walked, amusing his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her heeltaps were like tiny shields protecting her shoes from damage.
meanings.sent5: The shiny heeltaps gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The small amount of liquid left in a glass after drinking.
meanings.sent1: He took a sip and left only heeltaps in his glass.
meanings.sent2: The bartender cleared the table, collecting the heeltaps from each glass.
meanings.sent3: The heeltaps in the glass reminded him of the good times he had with friends.
meanings.sent4: The heeltaps at the bottom of the glass held the essence of the drink.
meanings.sent5: She always savored the heeltaps, finding them the most flavorful part of the drink.

meanings.definition: To tap one's heel on the ground as a sign of impatience or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: He heeltaps when waiting in line at the store.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but heeltaps during the long meeting.
meanings.sent3: The rhythmic heeltaps of the annoyed customer echoed in the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: His heeltaps sounded like a drumbeat of frustration on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The constant heeltaps created a sense of urgency in the room.
